column5: the girlfriend likes battered shrimp... so i was thinking i could do some home made battered shrimp for supper tonight...  first thought was "fish crisp"  anyone ever try this?  any other recipes...?  mike

Well, I can't see why not, you use it for other fish, I don't think it would take maybe 2-3 minutes in the deep fryer. Here's a few: http://www.google.ca/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=deep%20fry%20shrimp%20batter&source=web&cd=1&ved=0CCoQFjAA&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.cooks.com%2Frec%2Fsearch%2F0%2C1-00%2Cshrimp_batter_for_deep_frying%2CFF.html&ei=oIt4T_fMLObV0QGPm6GQDQ&usg=AFQjCNG0pA839qOgNt4hvsvoJycruVV_Zg&cad=rja
You need some panko bread crumbs and tampura mix.  Slivers of coconut will ballance nice with some spicy mango dip.  If you have the time butterfly the shrimp; just make it look nice
Healthy and tasty ones all start with real yeast.
Thanks all... Went with spagetti...  Gunna make the shrimp tomorrow...
Ya wimp..............Was it spaghetti-Os or Alphagetti?
Tempura! Don't have any recipes for you, though, sorry!
Mike.......are you interested in a "Blow Me Away" BBQ shrimp recipe...  But actually not done on the grill and VERY easy to do.  Bob

THIS IS A MIX I MAKE FOR BATTERING FISH AND SHRIMP. 1 CUP FLOUR,1 CUP WATER, 2 TBSP BAKING POWDER. TAKE ALL SEASON SPICE...THE KNOW THE STUFF THAT HAS A RED LOOK TO IT. MIX EVERYTHING TOGETHER AND ADD SEASONING TO TOP OF BATTER UNTIL BATTER LOOKS A LITTLE REDISH IN COLOUR. MAKE SURE THE FAT IS NICE AND HOT AND YOU WILL HAVE A VERY EASY BATTER AND TASTE GREAT.
My second laugh of the night!

Didn't have tge shrimp tonight either...lol  Got called at 730am to go to work for 8am.... Cause they forgot to tell me last week...  Then went for a boat ride and had Greek take out....  I will make em sooner or later...  Some tasty looking recipes so far...
Wimp ................Did the greek come in a can too
A tin take out tray if you must know...
took the easy way...  tried fish crisp beer batter...  it was really good... greasy...but good...
If you found it greasy, it might be better with hotter oil, Mike.
